p: Of the 21 participants, 14 were from state or local governments, two were consultants, two were academics, and one was from emergency services ( Table 2). The expertise and knowledge of the participants were diverse, as organizations and individuals differed in terms of the data they generate or use, services they provide, and their need for indicators. Analysis of the interview data generated five main themes with sub-themes. Themes related to the purpose of using indicators, types of data, criteria for selection of indicators, issues, and alternative indicators ( Table 3).
